intro: Melochia parvifolia subf. transiens, commonly known as the Transient Melochia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in disturbed soils or open habitats. It has a sprawling growth habit and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in warm climates.
